fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Competition, Enlargement, Energy, Business and Industry, Taxation, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Banking and financial services, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives:
We follow EU initiatives, policies and policy-making and legislative files in the context of our investment activities and regulatory responsibilities. This may include meetings with EU staff, and/or attendance at events at which EU staff may be present, but it is expected that these would be on an infrequent basis and for informational or research purposes only. 
 
We are primarily interested in the economic and financial policies pursued by the EU, including, but not limited to: economic and monetary union; banking union; financial supervision; financial regulation; EU financial assistance to member and non-member countries; EU budget allocation among member countries; and relations with non-member countries.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: Amia Capital LLP manages a discretionary global macro fund focusing on multi-asset class opportunities in developed and emerging markets on behalf of its clients.
